abstract: United Nations report alleges brutal crimes have been committed in South Sudan civil war fueled by some $20 million in arms spending by South Sudan government; UN Security Council is considering arms embargo unless Pres Salva Kiir signs peace treaty.
lead_paragraph: The study came as the Security Council considered a draft resolution that would impose an arms embargo on the country.

headline.main: U.N. Report Details Flow of Foreign Weapons Into South Sudan
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; South Sudan: U.N. Details Arms Sales Fueling War

snippet: The study came as the Security Council considered a draft resolution that would impose an arms embargo on the country.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
